intro: Micranthes interrupta, commonly known as the narrowleaf micranthes, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. The species is often found in wetland habitats and is characterized by its delicate, herbaceous appearance.
